column2: Complete the sentences. The second sentence means the same as the first.
column3:
I haven't been to a wedding for a long time.

It's {{c1::a long time since}} I went to a wedding.

column2: Complete the sentences. The second sentence means the same as the first.
column3:
They haven't had a holiday for five years.

{{c1::It's five years|It's been five years|It is five years|It has been five years}} since they had a holiday.

column2: Complete the sentences. The second sentence means the same as the first.
column3:
I haven't spoken to Laura for more than a month.

It's more than a month {{c1::since I spoke|since I've spoken|since I have spoken}} to Laura.

column2: Complete the sentences. The second sentence means the same as the first.
column3:
James hasn't ridden a bike for years.

{{c1::It's years since|It's been years since|It is years since|It has been years since}} James rode a bike.

column2: Complete the sentences. The second sentence means the same as the first.
column3:
We haven't eaten in a restaurant for a while.

It's a while {{c1::since we ate|since we've eaten|since we have eaten}} in a restaurant.

column2: Complete the sentences. The second sentence means the same as the first.
column3:
When was the last time you went swimming?

{{c1::How long is it|How long has it been}} since you went swimming?
